answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some resources that may be helpful.
The link below goes to a sample Employee Training Plan/Needs Assessment survey from Wisconsin.
http://oser.state.wi.us/docview.asp?docid=1322
I also found link to the Development and Implementation of a Public Health Workforce Training Needs Assessment Survey in North Carolina. It includes the survey and their process.
http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2569984/
Below is a sample survey used by the Michigan Federation for Children and Families to assess program managers and supervisors.
http://www.socialwork.msu.edu/outreach/docs/Program%20Manager%20and%20Supervisor%20Training%20Needs%20Assessment%20Instrument.pdf
I have also included the link to a list of generic sample questionnaires for training needs analysis.
http://www.dirjournal.com/guides/sample-questionnaires-for-training-needs-analyses/
Does anyone have experience with Training Needs Assessment Surveys that they could share?
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Lesley Boncich
text:
Our agency is planning to conduct a training needs assessment survey of all agency employees (about 850) and would be interested in seeing survey samples and hearing about "lessons learned"/recommendations from agencies who have conducted such a survey within recent years or from others with expertise/experience in this area.
Thank you
title: Training needs assessment surveys
